monster.name: Arcane Stalker

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The arcane stalker's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 15). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: detect magic, message
1/day: mirror image, phantasmal steed, see invisibility

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The arcane stalker has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Shadow Step
trait.text: While in dim light or darkness, the arcane stalker can teleport as a bonus action up to 60 ft. to an unoccupied space it can see that is also in dim light or darkness. It then has advantage on the first melee attack it makes before the end of the turn.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The arcane stalker makes two attacks.

action.name: Arcanis Sword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage. In addition, if the arcane stalker hits a spellcaster, the arcane stalker can use a bonus action to cast dispel magic.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
reaction.text: When an attacker that the arcane stalker can see hits it with an attack, the arcane stalker can use its reaction to halve the attack’s damage against it.

monster.spells: detect magic, message, mirror image, phantasmal steed, see invisibility
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 8 (Third Party)

monster.name: Basilisk, Giant
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

trait.name: Respect for the Rooster
trait.text: If the giant basilisk hears the crowing of a rooster it must make a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw, or flee the area. It can make the save again after each of its turns.

monster.name: Keen Smell
monster.text: The giant basilisk has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Petrifying Gaze
trait.text: If a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the giant basilisk and the two of them can see each other, the giant basilisk can force the creature to make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw if the basilisk isn’t incapacitated. On a failed save, the creature magically begins to turn to stone and is restrained. It must repeat the saving throw as the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified until freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic. A creature that isn’t surprised can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If it does so, it can’t see the giant basilisk until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If it looks at the giant basilisk in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The giant basilisk makes two bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage. The target must also make a successful DC 18 Constitution saving throw or take an additional 10 (3d6) poison damage.

monster.name: Poisonous Breath (3/day)
monster.text: The giant basilisk breathes out a poisonous breath in a 60-ft. cone. Any creatures in the area must make a successful DC 18 Constitution saving throw or take 31 (9d6) poison damage.
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 9 (Third Party)

monster.name: Boggart

trait.name: Frightening Form
trait.text: The boggart can use an action to transform into a form that would scare a target within 10 ft. The target must make a successful DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. It needs to use a bonus action to transform back into its true form.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The boggart's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: detect thoughts, prestidigitation
2/day each: invisibility, shocking grasp
1/day: confusion, dissonant whispers

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The boggart has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d6 + 1) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 10 (Third Party)

monster.name: Brownie

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: The brownie has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put it to sleep.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The brownie's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: druidcraft, goodberry
1/day: dancing lights

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Mimic Death
action.text: The brownie can collapse to the ground and appear to be dead. A DC 13 Intelligence (Investigation) check will reveal they are still alive.

monster.spells: druidcraft, goodberry, dancing lights
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 11 (Third Party)

monster.name: Centaur, Armored

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the armored centaur moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target then hits it with a longsword attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 4 (1d8) slashing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The armored centaur makes two attacks: one with its hooves and one with its sword.

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
reaction.text: The armored centaur adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the armored centaur must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 12 (Third Party)

monster.name: Centaur, Mage

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The centaur mage's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: blade ward, prestidigitation, shocking grasp
2/day: blur, charm person, hold person, scorching ray, shield, sleep
1/day: counterspell, fear

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The centaur mage has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Staff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

monster.spells: blade ward, prestidigitation, shocking grasp, blur, charm person, hold person, scorching ray, shield, sleep, counterspell, fear
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 13 (Third Party)

monster.name: Changeling

trait.name: Ambusher
trait.text: The changeling has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

trait.name: Doppelganger Ancestry
trait.text: The changeling has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t put it to sleep.

trait.name: Shapechanger
trait.text: As an action, the changeling can shapechange into a medium or smaller humanoid it has seen, or back into its true form. Any equipment it is wearing is transformed. If the changeling dies, it reverts to its true form.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 14 (Third Party)

monster.name: Doom Rider
monster.resist: cold, lightning, necrotic, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

trait.name: Turn Resistance
trait.text: The doom rider has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The doom rider makes two attacks: one with its antlers and one with its hooves.

action.name: Antlers
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Death Lance
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (3d6 + 8) piercing damage plus 22 (5d8) necrotic damage. The target’s hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage it takes. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 15 (Third Party)

monster.name: Doubt Trout

trait.name: Aura of Doubt
trait.text: Creatures within 30 feet of the doubt trout have disadvantage on saving throws. They must also make a successful DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or begin to doubt their decisions.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The doubt trout has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Phosphorescent Glow
trait.text: The doubt trout emits a bright orange color as bright light in a 20 ft. radius and dim light for an additional 10 ft.

trait.name: Water Breathing
trait.text: The doubt trout can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 16 (Third Party)

monster.name: Dream Dragon

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The dream dragon's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 19). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
1/day: color spray, confusion, dancing lights, detect thoughts

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The dream dragon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: The dream dragon’s attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dream dragon makes three attacks: two with its claws and one with its bite.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage.

action.name: Breath Weapon
action.text: The dream dragon breathes out a rainbow breath in a 90-ft. cone. This creates a hallucinatory terrain in which those affected must fight and defeat the dream dragon. If anyone in the area fails a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw, all targets in the 90-ft. cone enter the dream terrain. The only way to escape the dream terrain is to slay the dream dragon. Once the dream terrain is activated, the dream dragon chooses what form it takes. The dream dragon also is able to use an action to have an element from the terrain strike out and attack one target, the target must succeed on DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or take 60 (11d10) bludgeoning damage. The hallucinatory terrain is only destroyed if the dream dragon is defeated.

monster.spells: color spray, confusion, dancing lights, detect thoughts
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 17 (Third Party)

monster.name: Purple Dragon

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The purple dragon’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 21). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
1/day: charm person, detect magic, detect thoughts, dispel magic, hypnotic pattern, see invisibility, sleep, suggestion

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day)
trait.text: If the purple dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: The dream dragon’s attacks are magical.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
trait.text: While in dim light or darknes s, the purple dragon can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The purple dragon makes three attacks: two with its claws and one with its bite.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Dragon Shout (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The purple dragon lets out a draconic shout in a 90-ft. cone. Each creature in that area must make a successful DC 21 Constitution save or take 67 (15d8) force damage and be knocked prone. Or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Detect
legendary.text: The dragon makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Dragon Shout (costs 3 actions)
legendary.text: The dragon ses its shout attack.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
legendary.text: The dragon makes a tail attack.

monster.spells: charm person, detect magic, detect thoughts, dispel magic, hypnotic pattern, see invisibility, sleep, suggestion
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 18 (Third Party)

monster.name: Storm Dragon

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The storm dragon’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 22). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
2/day: control water, dispel magic, fog cloud, gust of wind
1/day: chain lightning, conjure elemental (water), control weather, plane shift, tsunami

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day)
trait.text: If the storm dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The storm dragon does double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Storm Vision
trait.text: The storm dragon can see normally through light or heavy obscurement caused by high winds, heavy rain, fog, clouds, or mist.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The storm dragon makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5-6).
action.text: The sea dragon shoots out a powerful burst of water in a 120-ft. line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a successful DC 22 Dexterity saving throw or take 88 (16d10) force damage and be knocked prone, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Detect
legendary.text: The dragon makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
legendary.text: The dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The storm dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the storm dragon must succeed on a DC 22 Dexterity saving throw or take 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The sea dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

monster.spells: control water, dispel magic, fog cloud, gust of wind, chain lightning, conjure elemental (water), control weather, plane shift, tsunami
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 19 (Third Party)

monster.name: Jabberwock
monster.immune: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The jabberwock has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: The jabberwock’s attacks are magical.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The jabberwock does double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Vorpal Vulnerability
trait.text: Three critical hits from magical swords (during one encounter) will behead the jabberwock and kill it immediately.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The jabberwock makes four attacks: two with its claws, one with its bite, and one with its tail.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 29 (5d8 + 7) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (4d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Eyes of Flame
action.text: The jabberwock sends out two rays from its flaming eyes up to 90 feet. It can target one or two creatures. The target must make a successful DC 20 Dexterity saving throw or take 42 (12d6) fire damage. Half damage on a save.

action.name: Burble (Recharges 5-6)
action.text: The jabberwock shouts nonsense words. Anyone in a 60-ft. cone in front of the jabberwock must make a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or suffer from the confusion spell for 1 minute.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 20 (Third Party)

monster.name: Quadrak

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The quadrak makes two attacks: one with its claws and one with its bite.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5-6).
action.text: The quadrak exhales fire in a 15-ft. cone. Each creature in the area must make a successful DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 21 (Third Party)

monster.name: Dryad Queen

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The dryad queen’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15, +9 to hit with spell attacks). The dryad queen can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
At will: druidcraft, goodberry
3/day: entangle, shillelagh, thorn whip
1/day: barkskin, dispel magic, pass without trace, plant growth, spike growth

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The dryad queen has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Tree Stride
trait.text: Once on each of its turns, the dryad queen can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically into one living tree within 5 feet of it and emerge from a second living tree within 60 feet of it that it can see, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second tree. Both trees must be Large or bigger.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
trait.text: The dryad queen can communicate with plants and beasts as if they shared a language.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dryad queen makes two attacks with her club.

action.name: Greatclub
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit (+9 to hit with shillelagh), reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Fey Charm
action.text: The dryad queen targets one humanoid or beast she can see within 30 ft. of her. If the target can see the dryad queen, it must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed. The charmed creature regards the dryad queen as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn’t under the dryad queen’s control, it takes the dryad queen’s requests or actions in the most favorable way it can. Each time the dryad queen or its allies do something harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours, or until the dryad queen dies, is on a different plane of existence than the target, or ends the effect as a bonus action. If a target’s saving throw is successful, the target is immune to the dryad queen’s Fey Charm for the next 24 hours. The dryad queen can have no more than one humanoid and up to three beasts charmed at the same time.

monster.spells: druidcraft, goodberry, entangle, shillelagh, thorn whip, barkskin, dispel magic, pass without trace, plant growth, spike growth
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 22 (Third Party)

monster.name: Elder Tree
monster.resist: bludgeoning and piercing damage from nonmagical weapons

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: If the elder tree remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a huge tree.

trait.name: Forest Sense
trait.text: The elder tree knows when harm is being done to the forest it lives in.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The elder tree’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 24, +19 to hit with spell attacks). The elder tree can innately cast the following druid spells, requiring no components.
At will: druidcraft, guidance, resistance, thorn whip
3/day: animal friendship, charm person, confusion, daylight, detect thoughts, dispel magic, entangle, goodberry, grasping vine (5th level), hallucinatory terrain, plant growth, spike growth
1/day: commune with nature, earthquake, foresight, mass cure wounds, move earth, regenerate

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The elder tree has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
trait.text: The elder tree can communicate with plants and beasts as if they shared a language.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The elder tree makes five root attacks.

action.name: Roots
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Summon Treants (1/day)
action.text: The elder tree can summon 1d4 treants, appearing in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of him.

action.name: Entangling Plants (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Grasping roots and vines sprout in a 60-foot radius centered on the elder tree, withering away after 10 minutes. For the duration, that area is difficult terrain for nonplant creatures. In addition, any creature the elder tree chooses in the area must succeed on a DC 24 Strength save or become restrained. A creature can use its action to make a DC 24 Strength check, freeing itself or another entangled creature within reach on a success.

monster.spells: druidcraft, guidance, resistance, thorn whip, animal friendship, charm person, confusion, daylight, detect thoughts, dispel magic, entangle, goodberry, grasping vine (5th level), hallucinatory terrain, plant growth, spike growth, commune with nature, earthquake, foresight, mass cure wounds, move earth, regenerate
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 23 (Third Party)

monster.name: Elf, Fey Knight

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: The fey knight has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put it to sleep.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The fey knight has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The fey knight makes two attacks

action.name: Sword of Light
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage plus an extra 4 (1d8) radiant damage. Can use a bonus action to light the sword, bright light in a 20 ft. radius.

action.name: Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Misty Escape (2/day)
reaction.text: The fey knight can cast misty step as a reaction.

reaction.name: Parry
reaction.text: The fey knight adds to 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the fey knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 24 (Third Party)

monster.name: Elf, Fey Noble

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The fey noble’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 16). The fey noble can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
At will: dancing lights, message, minor illusion
1/day: cure wounds, faerie fire, invisibility, silence

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: The fey noble has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put it to sleep.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The fey noble has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The fey noble makes three attacks.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: For 1 minute, the fey noble can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or saving throw. The creature can add d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand the fey noble. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the fey noble is incapacitated.

reaction.name: Misty Escape (3/day)
reaction.text: The fey noble can cast misty step as a reaction.

reaction.name: Parry
reaction.text: The fey noble adds to 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the fey noble must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monster.spells: dancing lights, message, minor illusion, cure wounds, faerie fire, invisibility, silence
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 25 (Third Party)

monster.name: Elf, Fey Ranger

trait.name: Cunning Action
trait.text: On each of its turns the fey ranger can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Evasion
trait.text: If the fey ranger is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the fey ranger instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The fey ranger’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 15). The fey ranger can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
At will: detect evil and good, pass without trace
1/day: entangle, misty step, speak with plants

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: The fey ranger has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put it to sleep.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The fey ranger has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight.
trait.text: The fey ranger has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The fey ranger makes two attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
reaction.text: The fey ranger halves the damage that it takes from an attack that hits it. The fey ranger must be able to see the attacker.

monster.spells: detect evil and good, pass without trace, entangle, misty step, speak with plants
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 26 (Third Party)

monster.name: Everflower

trait.name: Fey Step (Recharge 4-6)
trait.text: As a bonus action, an everflower can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space they can see.

trait.name: Martial Fury
trait.text: As a bonus action, the everflower can make one weapon attack. If it does so, attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The everflower makes two attacks.

action.name: Eversword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d10 + 1) slashing damage. This sword can also cut through any plants, including those made by magic.

action.name: Cloud of Bees (1/day)
action.text: The everflower can summon a swarm of insects (bees) and have them attack or use them to provide cover.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 27 (Third Party)

At will: druidcraft, speak with plants
1/day: faerie fire

trait.name: Magic Resistance

action.name: Scythe

monster.spells: druidcraft, speak with plants, faerie fire

At will: prestidigitation

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The faerie has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

monster.spells: prestidigitation, chill touch, dissonant whispers

monster.name: Fey Caterpillar

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The fey caterpillar can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on caverns, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) poison damage.

action.name: Smoke Rings
action.text: The fey caterpillar smokes a pipe and blows out large smoke rings in a 30-ft. cone. Each creature in the area must make successful DC 13 Dexterity saving throws or become trapped in a smoke ring. They are grappled, escape DC 13 .

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 32 (Third Party)

monster.name: Fey-touched

trait.name: Collective Psychic Illness
trait.text: Any humanoid within 5 ft. of the fey-touched must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw, or they can’t take reactions until the end of their next turn. On its turn, the target can’t move, and it uses its action to make a melee or ranged attack against a randomly determined creature within range. If the target can’t attack, it does nothing on its turn.

trait.name: Disoriented
trait.text: The fey-touched make their ability checks and saving throws with disadvantage.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 33 (Third Party)

monster.name: Frog Witch

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The frog witch’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 18, +11 to hit with spell attacks). The frog witch can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
At will: druidcraft, poison spray, thorn whip
3/day: animal messenger, dispel magic, entangle, fog cloud, jump, pass without trace, speak with animals, speak with plants, spike growth, water breathing
1/day: blight, confusion, dimension door, insect plague, tree stride

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The frog witch can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Leap
trait.text: The frog witch can make a 15 ft. horizontal jump.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The frog witch has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: The frog witch’s attacks are magical.

trait.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
trait.text: The frog witch can speak with frogs and toads.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The frog witch makes two attacks.

action.name: Swamp Staff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Tongue of the Toad
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage and the target must make a successful DC 18 Constitution saving throw or take an extra 24 (7d6) poison damage, taking half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Croak (Recharge 4-6)
action.text: The frog witch lets out a thunderous croak that does 31 (9d6) thunder damage in a 60 ft. radius unless a successful DC 18 Dexterity saving throw is made. Anyone in this area of effect must also make a DC 18 Strength save or be knocked prone.

action.name: Summon Frogs
action.text: The frog witch can summon 1d8 giant frogs 2/day. She usually has one of these creatures as her mount.

monster.spells: druidcraft, poison spray, thorn whip, animal messenger, dispel magic, entangle, fog cloud, jump, pass without trace, speak with animals, speak with plants, spike growth, water breathing, blight, confusion, dimension door, insect plague, tree stride
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 34 (Third Party)

monster.name: Frost Lord

trait.name: Fey Step (Recharge 4-6)
trait.text: As a bonus action, the frost lord can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space he can see.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The frost lord’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 19, +11 to hit with spell attacks). The frost lord can innately cast the following sorcerer spells, requiring no components.
At will: charm person, detect thoughts, ray of frost
3/day: bestow curse, cone of cold, counterspell, dispel magic, fog cloud, sleep, sleet storm
1/day: banishment, confusion, dominate person, ice storm

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The frost lord has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Wintery Movement
trait.text: The frost lord can travel through icy and snowy terrain with no penalty for difficult terrain.

action.name: Freezing Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The frost lord exhales a cold wind in a 60-ft. cone. Each creature in that area must make a successful DC 19 Constitution saving throw, taking 54 (12d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: For 1 minute, the frost lord can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or saving throw. The creature can add d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand the frost lord. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the frost lord is incapacitated.

reaction.name: Frigid Rebuke
reaction.text: When the frost lord takes damage from a creature the frost lord can see within 30 feet of him, the frost lord can force that creature to succeed on a DC 19 Constitution saving throw or take 16 (3d10) cold damage.

monster.spells: charm person, detect thoughts, ray of frost, bestow curse, cone of cold, counterspell, dispel magic, fog cloud, sleep, sleet storm, banishment, confusion, dominate person, ice storm
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 35 (Third Party)

monster.name: Mist Giant

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The mist giant’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 17). The mist giant can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
At will: dancing lights, minor illusion
1/day: gust of wind, thunderwave

trait.name: Lost in the Mist
trait.text: The mist giant has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks when taking the Hide action in thick mist, heavy rain, or a snowfall.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The mist giant has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The mist giant has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The mist giant makes three unarmed strikes.

action.name: Unarmed Attack
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

monster.spells: dancing lights, minor illusion, gust of wind, thunderwave
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 36 (Third Party)

monster.name: Mountain Lord

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The mountain lord has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The mountain lord deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The mountain lord makes three attacks with his diamond club or two unarmed strikes.

action.name: Diamond Club
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 37 (6d8 + 10) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Unarmed
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 36 (4d12 + 10) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Mountain Shout (Recharge 2-3)
action.text: The mountain lord lets out a booming shout in a 120-ft. cone. Any creatures in that area must make a successful DC 19 Strength saving throw or take 66 (12d10) force damage and be knocked prone. Half damage on a save.

action.name: Summon Giants (1/day)
action.text: The mountain lord can summon 1d4 hill giants, mist giants, or rock giants.

reaction.name: Mountain Endurance (3/day)
reaction.text: The mountain lord can focus himself to shrug off injuries. When he takes damage, he can use his reaction to roll a d20. The damage is reduced by that amount.

reaction.name: Rock Catching
reaction.text: If a rock or similar object is hurled at the mountain lord, he can, with a successful DC 9 Dexterity saving throw, catch the missile and take no bludgeoning damage from it.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 37 (Third Party)

monster.name: Rock Giant

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The rock giant deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Stone Camouflage
trait.text: The rock giant has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks to hide in rocky terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The rock giant makes three attacks with its fists or rocks.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. The rocks it throws are part of its body and reform after being pulled off.

action.name: Animate Boulders (1/day)
action.text: The rock giant can animate up to four boulders nearby and have them roll into any creatures within 90 ft. Targets must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, or take 22 (3d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage and fall prone.

reaction.name: Rock Catching
reaction.text: If a rock or similar object is hurled at the mountain lord, he can, with a successful DC 9 Dexterity saving throw, catch the missile and take no bludgeoning damage from it.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 38 (Third Party)

monster.name: Gnome, Lake

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The lake gnome can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Gnome Cunning
trait.text: The lake gnome has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The lake gnome’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13). The lake gnome can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
1/day: druidcraft, healing word, pass without trace

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The lake gnome has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Stone Camouflage
trait.text: The lake gnome has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks to hide in rocky terrain.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

action.name: Deep Knowledge
action.text: The lake gnome can help connect a creature to the essence of nature itself. However, this is not a smooth process. Any good or neutral creature within 5 feet of the lake gnome must make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw. If they fail the saving throw, their Wisdom score will increase by 1 permanently. However, they will also find themselves hallucinating and getting violently sick. These targets are incapacitated for 1 minute.

monster.spells: druidcraft, healing word, pass without trace
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 39 (Third Party)

monster.name: Goblin King

trait.name: Goblin Orb
trait.text: The goblin king carries three crystal orbs. He can use each one to cast minor illusion. After an orb is used it vanishes.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The goblin king’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 15). The goblin king can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
At will: dancing lights, prestidigitation
2/day: bane, crown of madness, detect thoughts
1/day: sleep

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The goblin king can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The goblin king makes three attacks with his scimitar.

action.name: Scimitar
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage and the target must make a successful DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 17 (5d6) poison damage

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: For 1 minute, the goblin king can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that he can see within 30 feet of him makes an attack roll or saving throw. The creature can add d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand the goblin king. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the goblin king is incapacitated.

reaction.name: Redirect Attack
reaction.text: When a creature the goblin king can see targets him with an attack, the goblin king chooses another goblin within 5 feet of him. The two goblins swap places, and the chosen goblin becomes the target instead.

monster.spells: dancing lights, prestidigitation, bane, crown of madness, detect thoughts, sleep
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 40 (Third Party)

monster.name: Goblin Shaman

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The goblin shaman’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13, +8 to hit with spell attacks). The goblin shaman can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
At will: firebolt, message
2/day: burning hands, charm person, detect thoughts, sleep
1/day: fireball, lightning bolt

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The goblin shaman has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
trait.text: The goblin shaman can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
trait.text: While in dim light or darkness, the goblin shaman can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The goblin shaman makes two attacks with its goat staff.

action.name: Goat Staff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage.

reaction.name: Redirect Attack
reaction.text: When a creature the goblin shaman can see targets him with an attack, the goblin shaman chooses another goblin within 5 feet of him. The two goblins swap places, and the chosen goblin becomes the target instead.

monster.spells: firebolt, message, burning hands, charm person, detect thoughts, sleep, fireball, lightning bolt
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 41 (Third Party)

monster.name: Goblin, Winged

trait.name: Aggressive
trait.text: As a bonus action, the winged goblin can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Brute
trait.text: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the winged goblin hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Clumsy Fliers
trait.text: The winged goblin is not adept at flying. Any Dexterity checks while flying are made with disadvantage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The winged goblin makes two attacks. One with its bite and one with its claws or spear.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) slashing damage and the target is grappled (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the winged goblin can’t use its claws on another target. However, if a target is grappled the winged goblin has advantage on any bite attacks against that target.

action.name: Spear
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 42 (Third Party)

monster.name: Gremlin

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The gremlin’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13). The gremlin can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
At will: prestidigitation
1/day: confusion

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The gremlin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The gremlin has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the gremlin’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
trait.text: While in dim light or darkness, the gremlin can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

action.name: Sabotage
action.text: The gremlin has advantage on Dexterity checks to sabotage any mechanical system or vehicle

monster.spells: prestidigitation, confusion
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 43 (Third Party)

monster.name: Forest Hag

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The forest hag’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). The forest hag can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
At will: dancing lights, druidcraft, thorn whip
1/day: confusion, grasping vine, gust of wind, sleep, spike growth, water breathing

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The forest hag has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Mushroom Stride
trait.text: While wearing her skull headdress, the forest hag can use 10 ft. of her movement to travel from one giant mushroom to another up to 30 ft. away.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants.
trait.text: The forest hag can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The forest hag makes two attacks with her claws.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Staff of Decomposing
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage and the target must make a successful DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 24 (7d6) poison damage. The staff can also dispel any plant-related spell.

action.name: Illusory Appearance
action.text: The forest hag covers herself and anything she is wearing with a magical illusion that makes her look like an ugly version of another forest humanoid. The effect ends if the hag takes a bonus action to end it or if she dies.

monster.spells: dancing lights, druidcraft, thorn whip, confusion, grasping vine, gust of wind, sleep, spike growth, water breathing
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 44 (Third Party)

monster.name: Harvest Maiden

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The harvest maiden’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). The harvest maiden can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
At will: firebolt, message
3/day: burning hands, charm person, detect thoughts, sleep
2/day: fireball, lightning bolt

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The harvest maiden has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants.
trait.text: The harvest maiden can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Stunning Kiss
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. The target must make a successful DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be stunned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns.

action.name: Smoky Charms (Recharge 2-3)
action.text: The harvest maiden targets one creature she can see within 30 feet of her. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Charisma saving throw or become charmed by the harvest maiden for 1 minute. The charmed target can repeat the saving throw if the harvest maiden does any damage to it. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the harvest maiden’s charms for 24 hours.

monster.spells: firebolt, message, burning hands, charm person, detect thoughts, sleep, fireball, lightning bolt
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 45 (Third Party)

monster.name: Hater

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: The hater has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put it to sleep.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The hater’s innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 13). The hater can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
At will: mage hand, prestidigitation
1/day: detect thoughts, dissonant whispers, fog cloud, vicious mockery

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

monster.spells: mage hand, prestidigitation, detect thoughts, dissonant whispers, fog cloud, vicious mockery
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 46 (Third Party)

monster.name: Hatter

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: The hatter has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put it to sleep.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The hatter’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 16). The hatter can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
At will: detect thoughts, mage hand, prestidigitation
2/day: charm person, counterspell, dispel magic, vicious mockery
1/day: dominate person, modify memory, suggestion

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The hatter has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The hatter makes two attacks with his hats.

action.name: Throw Hat
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. On a hit, the hat lands on the target’s head. Each type of hat is different. The hatter has two of each hat in his bag.

action.name: Spring Hat
action.text: The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or fall asleep and remain unconscious for 1 minute. The targeted creature awakens if it takes damage or another creature takes an action to wake it. It has no effect on constructs and undead.

action.name: Summer Hat
action.text: The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by the hatter for 1 hour, or until the hatter harms the creature.

action.name: Autumn Hat
action.text: The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or suffer the effects of a confusion spell.

action.name: Winter Hat
action.text: The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target’s speed is halved for 1 minute. In addition, the creature can’t take reactions, and it can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.spells: detect thoughts, mage hand, prestidigitation, charm person, counterspell, dispel magic, vicious mockery, dominate person, modify memory, suggestion
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 47 (Third Party)

monster.name: Headless Horseman
monster.resist: necrotic, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

trait.name: Turn Resistance
trait.text: The headless horseman has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The headless horseman makes two attacks with its greataxe or one magical pumpkin attack.

action.name: Greataxe
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d12 + 2) slashing damage.

action.name: Flaming Pumpkin
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 48 (Third Party)

monster.name: Huntaur

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the huntaur moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target then hits it with a longsword attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 4 (1d8) slashing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The armorThe huntaur makes two attacks: one with its hooves and one with its sword or bow.

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
action.text: Ranged weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 +3) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
reaction.text: The huntaure adds to 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the huntaur must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 49 (Third Party)

monster.name: Ice Princess

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The ice princess’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 17, +8 to hit with spell attacks). The ice princess can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
At will: chill touch, ray of frost
2/day: charm person, fog cloud, sleep
1/day: bestow curse, detect thoughts, sleet storm

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The ice princess has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The ice princess makes two attacks with her ice swords.

action.name: Ice Swords
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage plus 9 (2d8) cold damage.

action.name: Frozen Song (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The ice princess sings a magical melody. Every humanoid within 90 feet of the ice princess must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or be frozen (paralyzed). A paralyzed target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. The ice princess must take a bonus action on its subsequent turns to continue singing. She can stop singing at any time. The song ends if the ice princess is incapacitated. A target that successfully saves is immune to this ice princess’s song for the next 24 hours.

reaction.name: Frigid Rebuke
reaction.text: When the ice princess takes damage from a creature she can see within 30 feet of her, the ice princess can force that creature to succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or take 11 (2d10) cold damage.

monster.spells: chill touch, ray of frost, charm person, fog cloud, sleep, bestow curse, detect thoughts, sleet storm
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 50 (Third Party)

monster.name: Lady of Swans

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The lady can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The lady’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 17). The lady can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
At will: animal friendship, dancing lights, druidcraft, guidance, water walk
3/day: charm person, create or destroy water, detect thoughts, dispel magic, fog cloud, mirror image, sleep
1/day: animate objects, confusion, conjure elemental, control water, dimension door, mass cure wounds, modify memory, project image

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The lady has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants.
trait.text: The lady can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

action.name: Water Jet (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Sends out a 60-ft. line of water that is 5 ft. wide. Each creature in the area must make a successful DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or take 24 (7d6) force damage, or half damage on a save.

action.name: Summon Giant Swans (1/day)
action.text: The lady can summon 1d8 giant swans. They appear in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of her.

reaction.name: Foster Peace
reaction.text: If a creature charmed by the lady hits with an attack roll while within 60 feet of the lady, the lady magically causes the attack to miss, provided the lady can see the attacker.

monster.spells: animal friendship, dancing lights, druidcraft, guidance, water walk, charm person, create or destroy water, detect thoughts, dispel magic, fog cloud, mirror image, sleep, animate objects, confusion, conjure elemental, control water, dimension door, mass cure wounds, modify memory, project image
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 51 (Third Party)

monster.name: Log Shadow

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
trait.text: The log shadow can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 3 (1d6) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The log shadow has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Strangle
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Log Step
action.text: The log shadow attempts to make a deal with whoever enters its log. If the deal is acceptable, the log shadow can send a creature to an empty log within the forest, of the target’s choosing. If the deal goes badly, the log shadow will either attack and strangle the target or send the target to an empty log of its choice.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 52 (Third Party)

monster.name: Lycanthrope, Werebadger
monster.immune: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
trait.text: The werebadger has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell

trait.name: Shapechanger
trait.text: The werebadger can use its action to polymorph into a small badgerhumanoid hybrid or into a giant badger, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than size and AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

action.name: Bite (Badger or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werebadger lycanthropy.

action.name: Claw (Badger or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 53 (Third Party)

monster.name: Lycanthrope, Werefox
monster.immune: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
trait.text: The werefox has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Shapechanger
trait.text: The werefox can use its action to polymorph into a medium fox-humanoid hybrid or into a giant fox, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than size and AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

action.name: Bite (Fox or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d8) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werefox lycanthropy.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Charm
action.text: One humanoid the werefox can see within 30 feet of it must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed for 1 minute. The charmed target obeys the werefox’s verbal commands. If the target suffers any harm or receives a command that will put them in danger, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. If the target successfully saves against the effect, or if the effect on it ends, the target is immune to the werefox’s charm for the next 24 hours. The werefox can have only one target charmed at a time. If it charms another, the effect on the previous target ends.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 54 (Third Party)

monster.name: Lycanthrope, Wererabbit
monster.immune: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
trait.text: The wererabbit has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The wererabbit innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13). The wererabbit can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
1/day: expeditious retreat, haste, longstrider

trait.name: Shapechanger
trait.text: The wererabbit can use its action to polymorph into a small rabbit-humanoid hybrid or into a giant rabbit, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than size and AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

action.name: Bite (Rabbit or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with wererabbit lycanthropy.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 55 (Third Party)

monster.name: Master of the Hunt

trait.name: Feral Senses
trait.text: The master has preternatural senses that help him fight creatures he can’t see. He doesn’t fight at disadvantage against a creature he can’t see. The master is also aware of the location of any invisible creature within 30 ft. of him, provided the creature isn’t hidden from him and he isn’t blinded or deafened.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The master’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 15). The master can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
At will: druidcraft, hunter’s mark, pass without trace
3/day: charm person, fog cloud, mirror image, sleep
1/day: detect thoughts, dispel magic

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The master has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants.
trait.text: The master can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The master makes three attacks.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Ethereal Stride
action.text: The master magically enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.

action.name: Wild Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest).
action.text: For 1 minute, the master can utter a special command or warning whenever a member of the Wild Hunt that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or saving throw. The creature can add d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand the master. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the master is incapacitated.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
reaction.text: When an attacker that the master can see hits him with an attack, he can use his reaction to halve the attack’s damage against him.

monster.spells: druidcraft, hunter’s mark, pass without trace, charm person, fog cloud, mirror image, sleep, detect thoughts, dispel magic
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 56 (Third Party)

monster.name: Mist Phantom
monster.resist: acid, cold, lightning, necrotic, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Annihilating Aura
trait.text: Any creature that starts its turn within 30 ft of the mist phantom must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or take 7 (2d6) necrotic damage and grant the mist phantom advantage on attack rolls against it until the start of the creature’s next turn. Undead are immune to this aura.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
trait.text: The mist phantom can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 3 (1d6) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: The mist phantom takes 10 radiant damage whenever it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, the mist wraith has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
trait.text: The mist phantom has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

action.name: Life Drain
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage plus the target must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw (undead and constructs automatically succeed), or it takes 24 (7d6) necrotic damage, and the target’s hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 57 (Third Party)

monster.name: Night Hound

trait.name: Faultless Tracker
trait.text: The night hound is given a quarry by its master. The quarry be a specific creature (small or smaller size) or an object the master is personally acquainted with, or it can be a general type of creature or object the master has seen before. The night hound knows the direction and distance to its quarry as long as the two of them are on the same plane of existence. The night hound can have only one such quarry at a time. The night hound also always knows the location of its master.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The hound has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The night hound makes two bite attacks

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage. The night hound can also choose to grapple a target (escape DC 13).

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 58 (Third Party)

monster.name: Nymph

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The nymph can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The nymph’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). The nymph can innately cast the following druid spells, requiring no components.
At will: detect magic, druidcraft, guidance, light
2/day: cure wounds, goodberry, lesser restoration
1/day: grasping vine, tree stride

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The nymph has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants.
trait.text: The nymph can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

action.name: Club
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Blinding Beauty
action.text: If a humanoid starts its turn within 30 feet of the nymph and can see it, she can force the creature to make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is magically blinded. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A humanoid that isn’t surprised can avert their eyes.

monster.spells: detect magic, druidcraft, guidance, light, cure wounds, goodberry, lesser restoration, grasping vine, tree stride
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 59 (Third Party)

monster.name: Oak Lord

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The oak lord’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 18). The oak lord can innately cast the following druid spells, requiring no components.
At will: druidcraft, guidance, thorn whip
3/day: animal friendship, animal messenger, dispel magic, hold person, spike growth, tree stride
1/day: blight, commune with nature, conjure woodland beings, freedom of movement, grasping vine, heal, heroes feast, polymorph, sunbeam, wall of thorns

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The oak lord has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: The oak lord’s attacks are magical.

trait.name: Shapechange
trait.text: Using a bonus action, the oak lord can shapechange into a centaur or back to his true form. All his equipment is transformed as well.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants.
trait.text: The oak lord can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The oak lord makes three attacks with his greatsword in humanoid form or three attacks with his hooves in centaur form.

action.name: Greatsword of the Deep Woods
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (4d6 + 5) slashing damage.

action.name: Hooves (In Centaur Form)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Summon Centaurs (1/day)
action.text: The oak lord can summon 1d4 centaurs. They appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of him.

monster.spells: druidcraft, guidance, thorn whip, animal friendship, animal messenger, dispel magic, hold person, spike growth, tree stride, blight, commune with nature, conjure woodland beings, freedom of movement, grasping vine, heal, heroes feast, polymorph, sunbeam, wall of thorns
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 60 (Third Party)

monster.name: King Oberon

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: Oberon’s innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 19). Oberon can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
At will: druidcraft, friends, light
3/day: charm person, confusion, counterspell, detect thoughts, dimension door, dispel magic, fog cloud, heal, sleep, thunderwave, tree stride
1/day: animate objects, banishment, dominate person, feeblemind, foresight, globe of invulnerability, modify memory, phantom steed, scrying, sunburst

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Oberon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: Oberon’s attacks are magical.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants.
trait.text: Oberon can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Oberon makes three attacks with his sword.

action.name: +3 Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (1d10 + 8) slashing damage plus 11 (2d10) radiant damage and reduces the target’s hit point maximum by the same amount. The target must finish a short or long rest to regain these hit points.

action.name: Summon Unicorns (1/day)
action.text: He can summon 1d4 unicorns. They appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of him.

monster.spells: druidcraft, friends, light, charm person, confusion, counterspell, detect thoughts, dimension door, dispel magic, fog cloud, heal, sleep, thunderwave, tree stride, animate objects, banishment, dominate person, feeblemind, foresight, globe of invulnerability, modify memory, phantom steed, scrying, sunburst
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 61 (Third Party)

monster.name: Ogre King

trait.name: Aggressive
trait.text: As a bonus action, the ogre king can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Brute
trait.text: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the ogre king hits with it (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The ogre king makes three attacks with his mace or two with his shield.

action.name: Mace of Chaos
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage. Target must make a successful DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute.

action.name: Shield Smash
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage and the target must make a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 62 (Third Party)

monster.name: Ogre Mage

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The ogre mage’s innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 15, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The ogre mage can innately cast the following sorcerer spells, requiring no components.
At will: blade ward, prestidigitation
2/day: burning hands, mage armor, thunderwave, witch bolt
1/day: cloud of daggers, fireball, lightning bolt, scorching ray

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The ogre mage makes two attacks with his staff.

action.name: Staff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage

monster.spells: blade ward, prestidigitation, burning hands, mage armor, thunderwave, witch bolt, cloud of daggers, fireball, lightning bolt, scorching ray
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 63 (Third Party)

monster.name: Orchid

trait.name: Fey Step (Recharge 4-6)
trait.text: As a bonus action, Orchid can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space they can see.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: Orchid’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 19). Orchid can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
At will: dancing lights, druidcraft
3/day: blur, charm person, counterspell, dispel magic
1/day: dimension door, dominate person, pass without trace, tree stride

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Orchid has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: Orchid’s attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Orchid makes three attacks with her sword.

action.name: Honey Sword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage. Her sword drips with honey and some of it sticks to a creature she hits. If she is successful with a hit, she has advantage on all further sword attacks against that target.

action.name: Pollen Cloud (3/day)
action.text: Orchid releases a pollen cloud that fills a 20 ft. radius centered on her, lingering for 1 minute. Humanoids and beasts in the cloud when it appears, or that enter it later, must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the creature can’t be affected by the cloud for 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature is consumed with feelings of euphoria and is under the same effect as the confusion spell.

monster.spells: dancing lights, druidcraft, blur, charm person, counterspell, dispel magic, dimension door, dominate person, pass without trace, tree stride
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 64 (Third Party)

monster.name: Pond of Reflection

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: The pond of reflection is indistinguishable from a normal pond.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The pond has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Entrancing Reflection
action.text: Anyone looking into the pond sees the most beautiful version of themselves. First the viewer must make a successful DC 13 Wisdom saving throw. If they fail, watery hands reach up and pull the target into the pond. The victim must then make a successful DC 13 Strength check. A successful Strength save enables the target to pull itself out of the pond. If they fail, the target takes 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage and lose two levels of exhaustion as they begin to be drowned. They continue to lose a level of exhaustion each turn if they can’t get out of the pond. The target or another creature can make a DC 13 Strength check to get out, or help to get out.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 65 (Third Party)

monster.name: Prince of the Pipes

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The prince’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 16). The prince can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
At will: druidcraft, pass without trace, speak with animals
3/day: animal messenger, detect thoughts

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The prince has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The prince makes two attacks.

action.name: Ram
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: +1 Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d6 + 6) piercing damage.

action.name: +1 Shortbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d6 + 6) piercing damage.

action.name: Pipes of Feyland
action.text: The prince plays his pipes and chooses one of the following magical effects: a charming melody, a slow melody, or a paralyzing song. Any creature within 90 feet of the prince that can hear the pipes must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or be affected as described below. Other satyrs and creatures that can’t be charmed are unaffected. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature’s saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to these panpipes for the next 24 hours.
Charming Melody. The creature is charmed by the prince for 1 minute. If the prince or any of his companions harms the creature, the effect on it ends immediately.
Slow Melody. The creature has its speed halved for 1 minute. In addition, the creature can’t take reactions, and it can take either an action or a bonus action.
Paralyzing Song. The creature is paralyzed for 1 minute.
