monster.spells: druidcraft, pass without trace, speak with animals, animal messenger, detect thoughts
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 66 (Third Party)

monster.name: Prince of Twilight

trait.name: Fey Step (Recharge 4-6)
trait.text: As a bonus action, the prince can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space they can see.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The prince’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 18). The prince can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
At will: dancing lights, detect thoughts, illusory script, minor illusion, prestidigitation
2/day: blur, disguise self, mage armor, mirror image, silent image, suggestion
1/day: color spray, dream, greater invisibility, hallucinatory terrain, major image, mislead, phantasmal force, phantasmal killer, programmed illusion, silence

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The prince has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The prince makes three attacks with his magical daggers, and another three with his off hand.

action.name: +2 Dagger
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d4 + 7) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

action.name: Enthralling Gaze
action.text: The prince targets one creature he can see within 60 feet of him. The target must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or become charmed by the prince for 24 hours. The charmed target can repeat the saving throw at the end of the next two turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.spells: dancing lights, detect thoughts, illusory script, minor illusion, prestidigitation, blur, disguise self, mage armor, mirror image, silent image, suggestion, color spray, dream, greater invisibility, hallucinatory terrain, major image, mislead, phantasmal force, phantasmal killer, programmed illusion, silence
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 67 (Third Party)

monster.name: Protea

trait.name: Damage Transfer
trait.text: While it is grappling a creature, the protea takes only half the damage dealt to it, and the creature trapped inside takes the other half.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) poison damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the protea can’t bite another target.

action.name: Swallow
action.text: The protea makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed target is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the protea, and it takes 10 (3d6) acid damage at the start of each of the protea’s turns. The protea can have only one target swallowed at a time. If the protea dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the plant using 5 feet of movement, exiting prone.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 68 (Third Party)

monster.name: Queen of Darkness

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The queen’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 21, +15 to hit with spell attacks). The queen can innately cast the following sorcerer spells, requiring no components.
At will: acid splash, fire bolt, poison spray, shocking grasp
3/day: animate dead, animate objects, bestow curse, blight, charm person, confusion, detect thoughts, dispel magic, fog cloud, sleep, mirror image, misty step
1/day: disintegrate, dominate person, finger of death, forcecage, incendiary cloud, modify memory, power word kill, scrying

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The queen has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: The queen’s attacks are magical.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants.
trait.text: The queen can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The queen makes three attacks.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 23 (4d8 + 5) slashing damage and the target’s hit point maximum is also reduced by the same amount. The target must finish a Short or Long rest to regain these hit points.

action.name: Lightning Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The queen exhales lightning in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 21 Dexterity saving throw, taking 72 (16d8) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Summon Swarms of Bats (2/day).
action.text: As a bonus action, the queen can summon 1d6 giant bats. They appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of the queen

monster.spells: acid splash, fire bolt, poison spray, shocking grasp, animate dead, animate objects, bestow curse, blight, charm person, confusion, detect thoughts, dispel magic, fog cloud, sleep, mirror image, misty step, disintegrate, dominate person, finger of death, forcecage, incendiary cloud, modify memory, power word kill, scrying
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 69 (Third Party)

monster.name: Rainman
monster.resist: acid, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, restrained

trait.name: Water Blend
trait.text: The rainman has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks when he attempts to hide in water.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The rainman has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: The rainman’s attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The rainman makes two attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Drown (Recharge 2-3)
action.text: Each creature within 10 ft. of the rainman must make a DC 13 Strength saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If it is Medium or smaller, it is also grappled (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and unable to breathe unless it can breathe water. If the saving throw is successful, the target is pushed out of the rainman’s space. The rainman can only grapple one Medium creature or up to two Small or Tiny creatures at one time with this ability. At the start of each of the rainman’s turns, each grappled target takes 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage. As an action, a creature within 5 feet of the rainman can pull a creature or an object away from it by succeeding on a DC 13 Strength check.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 70 (Third Party)

monster.name: Rhododeadrum

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the rhododeadrum remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary rhododendron.

action.name: Sonic Burst
action.text: When a creature is within 30 feet of the rhododeadrum, the plant emits a loud sonic burst. The target must make a successful DC 13 Constitution saving throw or become deafened for 1 minute and take 2 (1d4) force damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 71 (Third Party)

monster.name: Riverwind

trait.name: Fey Step (Recharge 4-6)
trait.text: As a bonus action, Riverwind can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space they can see.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: Riverwind’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). Riverwind can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
At will: detect magic, druidcraft, faerie fire
3/day: charm person, control water, counterspell, fog cloud, sleep, water walk
1/day: banishment, confusion, gust of wind, project image

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Orchid has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: Orchid’s attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Riverwind makes two attacks.

action.name: +2 Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d10 + 6) piercing damage.

action.name: +3 Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d8 + 7) piercing damage.

action.name: Whirlwind (Recharge 4-6)
action.text: Each creature in a 10 ft. radius centered on Riverwind must make a DC 17 Strength saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 40 (9d8) bludgeoning damage and is flung up to 30 feet away from Riverwind in a random direction and knocked prone. If a thrown target strikes an object, such as a tree or rock, the target takes 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked prone. If the saving throw is successful, the target takes half the bludgeoning damage and isn’t flung away or knocked prone.

monster.spells: detect magic, druidcraft, faerie fire, charm person, control water, counterspell, fog cloud, sleep, water walk, banishment, confusion, gust of wind, project image
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 72 (Third Party)

monster.name: Royal Stag
monster.immune: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons.
monster.languages: Giant Elk, Understands Sylvan and Elvish, but can’t speak them

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the royal stag moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw

trait.name: Forest Stride
trait.text: The royal stag ignores all difficult terrain within a forest.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The royal stag’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13). The royal stag can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
At will: druidcraft
1/day: charm person, cure wounds, sleep

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The royal stag has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The royal stag makes two attacks: one with its antlers and one with its hooves.

action.name: Antlers
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 32 (6d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

monster.spells: druidcraft, charm person, cure wounds, sleep
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 73 (Third Party)

monster.name: Ruined Tree

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: If the ruined tree remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a rotten tree

trait.name: Roots Wrap
trait.text: If the target reaches 0 hit points, they are completely decomposed and absorbed into the ruined tree. Each time this happens, the ruined tree gains an extra 10 hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The ruined tree makes two branch attacks.

action.name: Shoot Branch
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d6 + 1) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 74 (Third Party)

monster.name: Sandman

trait.name: Dark Stalker
trait.text: The sandman has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks in dim light or darkness.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The sandman has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Shadow Step
trait.text: While in dim light or darkness, the sandman can teleport as a bonus action up to 60 ft. to an unoccupied space it can see that is also in dim light or darkness. It then has advantage on the first melee attack it makes before the end of the turn.

action.name: Strangle
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage and the target must make a successful DC 14 Strength check or become grappled (escape DC 14).

action.name: Magical Sand
action.text: The sandman uses an action to sprinkle magical sand. Unless the target makes a successful DC 14 Wisdom saving throw, they fall asleep and are unconscious for 1 hour. The effect ends if the creature takes damage or if someone takes an action to shake the creature awake. The target has terrible dreams during their next long rest. An ally can make a DC 14 Wisdom (Perception) check to notice the target is troubled. They can they then take an action to wake the target. If nobody wakes the target during their one-hour sleep, they take 7 (2d6) psychic damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 75 (Third Party)

monster.name: Shadow Bird

trait.name: Distant Eyes
trait.text: Powerful evil spellcasters often use scrying to see through the eyes of a shadow bird.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The shadow bird has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the shadow bird’s allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The shadow bird makes two attacks, one with its claws and one with its bite.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) slashing damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 76 (Third Party)

monster.name: Shadowy Tree
monster.immune: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons, fire, psychic

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: If the shadowy tree remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal tree.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The tree has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The shadowy tree makes four slam attacks and one bite attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) necrotic damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 17). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the shadowy tree can’t bite another target.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage. The target must also make a DC 17 Dexterity check or be knocked prone.

action.name: Swallow
action.text: The shadowy tree makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed target is blinded and restrained. If has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the shadowy tree, and it takes 17 (5d6) necrotic damage at the start of each of the shadowy tree’s turns. The tree can only have one target swallowed at a time. If the shadowy tree dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the trunk using 5 feet of movement, exiting prone.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 77 (Third Party)

monster.name: Siren

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The siren can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The siren’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 14). The siren can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
2/day: detect thoughts, sleep

trait.name: Shapechanger
trait.text: As an action, the siren can shapechange into a medium female humanoid, or back into its true form. If the siren dies, it reverts to its true form.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The siren makes two attacks with her claws.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d6 + 1) slashing damage.

action.name: Luring Song
action.text: The siren sings a magical melody. Every humanoid and giant within 300 feet of the siren that can hear the song must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed until the song ends. The siren must take bonus action on its subsequent turns to continue singing. It can stop singing at any time. The song ends if the siren is incapacitated. While charmed by the siren, a target is incapacitated and ignores the songs of other sirens. If the charmed target is more than 5 feet away from the siren, the target must move on its turn towards the siren by the most direct route, trying to get within 5 feet. It doesn’t avoid opportunity attacks, but before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage from a source other than the siren, the target can repeat the saving throw. A charmed target can also repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If the saving throw is successful, the effect ends on it. A target that successfully saves is immune to this siren’s song for the next 24 hours.

monster.spells: detect thoughts, sleep
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 78 (Third Party)

monster.name: Skeletal Spider

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the skeletal spider has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Web Walker
trait.text: The skeletal spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The skeletal spider makes two bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 22 (5d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way.

action.name: Web (Recharge 5-6).
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 40/60 ft., one target. Hit: The target is restrained by webbing. As an action, the restrained target can make a DC 15 Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 12, hp 20; vulnerability to fire damage, immunity to bludgeoning, necrotic, poison, and psychic damage).

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 79 (Third Party)

monster.name: Skeleton King

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: His innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 21, +13 to hit with spell attacks). The skeleton king can innately cast the following wizard spells, requiring no components.
At will: blade ward, fire bolt, mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation

3/day: animate dead, animate objects, bestow curse, blight, confusion, detect thoughts, dimension door, dispel magic, dominate person, fog cloud, mirror image, misty step, modify memory, ray of sickness, sleep
1/day: circle of death, feeblemind, finger of death, mass suggestion, reverse gravity, scrying, time stop

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The skeleton king has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The skeleton king can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The skeleton king makes three attacks with his staff.

action.name: Staff of the Skull
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage. Target must make DC 21 Constitution saving throw or take an extra 21 (6d6) necrotic damage, taking half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Summon Skeletons
action.text: The skeleton king can summon 1d12 skeletons twice a day and 1d6 minotaur skeletons once a day. They appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of the skeleton king.

action.name: Dark Smile (Recharge 2-3)
action.text: The skeleton king fixes his evil smile on one creature he can see within 30 ft. of him. The target must make a successful DC 21 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become charmed for 1 minute. The charmed target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target saves they are immune to the smile for the next 24 hrs.

monster.spells: blade ward, fire bolt, mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation, animate dead, animate objects, bestow curse, blight, confusion, detect thoughts, dimension door, dispel magic, dominate person, fog cloud, mirror image, misty step, modify memory, ray of sickness, sleep, circle of death, feeblemind, finger of death, mass suggestion, reverse gravity, scrying, time stop
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 80 (Third Party)

monster.name: Skeleton Warrior
monster.languages: understands all languages it knew in life but can’t speak

trait.name: Turn Resistance
trait.text: The skeleton warrior has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The skeleton warrior makes two attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 81 (Third Party)

monster.name: Snow Queen

trait.name: Frozen Presence
trait.text: Any creatures within 60 feet of the snow queen must make a successful DC19 Constitution saving throw or become frozen (paralyzed) for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The snow queen’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 19, +11 to hit with spell attacks). The snow queen can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
At will: chill touch, mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost
3/day: bestow curse, cone of cold, darkness, detect thoughts, dispel magic, ice storm, locate creature, magic missile, misty step, scrying, shield, sleet storm, wall of ice
1/day: control weather, finger of death, imprisonment

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The snow queen has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The snow queen makes two attacks with her Snow Spear.

action.name: Snow Spear
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) piercing damage plus 31 (9d6) cold damage.

action.name: Snow Scream (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The snow queen lets out a scream that sends a burst of snow in a 90-ft. cone. Any creatures in the area must make a successful DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or take 52 (15d6) cold damage, half damage on a success. The area also becomes difficult terrain for the next 10 minutes.

reaction.name: Frigid Rebuke
reaction.text: When the snow queen takes damage from a creature the snow queen can see within 60 feet of her, the snow queen can force that creature to succeed on a DC 19 Constitution saving throw or take 16 (3d10) cold damage.

monster.spells: chill touch, mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost, bestow curse, cone of cold, darkness, detect thoughts, dispel magic, ice storm, locate creature, magic missile, misty step, scrying, shield, sleet storm, wall of ice, control weather, finger of death, imprisonment
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 82 (Third Party)

monster.name: Sprite Knight

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The sprite knight’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13). The sprite knight can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
At will: druidcraft, faerie fire
1/day: charm person, fog cloud, mirror image

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The sprite knight makes two attacks.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 slashing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. If its saving throw result is 7 or lower, the poisoned target falls unconscious for the same duration, or until it takes damage or another creature takes an additional action to shake it awake.

action.name: Heart Sight
action.text: The sprite knight touches a creature and magically knows the creature’s current emotional state. If the target fails a DC 13 Charisma saving throw, the sprite knight also knows the creature’s alignment. Celestials, fiends, and undead automatically fail the saving throw.

action.name: Invisibility
action.text: The sprite knight magically turns invisible until it attacks or casts a spell, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the sprite knight wears or carries is invisible with it.

monster.spells: druidcraft, faerie fire, charm person, fog cloud, mirror image
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 83 (Third Party)

monster.name: Storyweaver

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The storyweaver’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 16). The storyweaver can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
At will: friends, mage hand, prestidigitation, vicious mockery
2/day: calm emotions, charm person, confusion, cure wounds, detect thoughts, disguise self, dispel magic, hypnotic pattern, illusory script, nondetection, suggestion
1/day: compulsion, dimension door, dream, greater invisibility, hallucinatory terrain, legend lore

trait.name: Inscrutable
trait.text: The storyweaver is immune to any effect that would sense his emotions or read his thoughts, as well as any divination spell that he refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the storyweaver’s intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The storyweaver has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The storyweaver makes three attacks with his quarterstaff.

action.name: +3 Quarterstaff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Creative License (2/day)
action.text: The storyweaver begins a story and anyone within 60 ft. must make a successful DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed for 1 minute. Whoever hears the story, hears it in their language.

action.name: Drone (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The storyweaver begins to drone on and on, any creatures within 60 ft. must make a successful DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or fall asleep for 1 minute. Sleeping targets are awakened if any damage is done to them. Another creature can use an action to wake a sleeping target. Whoever hears the storyweaver, hears him in their language.

monster.spells: friends, mage hand, prestidigitation, vicious mockery, calm emotions, charm person, confusion, cure wounds, detect thoughts, disguise self, dispel magic, hypnotic pattern, illusory script, nondetection, suggestion, compulsion, dimension door, dream, greater invisibility, hallucinatory terrain, legend lore
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 84 (Third Party)

monster.name: Swan Maiden

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The swan maiden can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Shapechanger
trait.text: As an action, the swan maiden can shapechange into a giant swan, or back into its true form. If the swan maiden dies, it reverts to its true form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The swan maiden has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Summon Water Elemental (1/day)
action.text: The swan maiden can summon a water elemental once a day. The elemental will obey its every command.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 85 (Third Party)

monster.name: Sylph

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The sylph’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13). The sylph can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
At will: invisibility
1/day: conjure minor elemental (air)

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The sylph has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Beat Wings
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) force damage and target must make a DC 13 Strength saving throw or fall prone.

monster.spells: invisibility, conjure minor elemental
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 86 (Third Party)

monster.name: Thresholder

trait.name: Cunning Action
trait.text: The thresholder can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The thresholder has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The thresholder makes three attacks.

action.name: Gatekeeper Staff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (3d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 87 (Third Party)

monster.name: Queen Titania

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: Titania’s innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 20). Titania can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
At will: dancing lights, druidcraft, faerie fire, light, message

3/day: animate objects, banishment, charm person, counterspell, confusion, detect magic, detect thoughts, dimension door, dispel magic, fog cloud, hypnotic pattern, invisibility, mirror image, modify memory
1/day: control weather, heal, mass suggestion, mirage arcane, wish

trait.name: Illumination
trait.text: Titania sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Titania has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: Titania’s attacks are magical.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants.
trait.text: Titania can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Titania makes three attacks.

action.name: Diamond Wand
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 12 (1d10 + 7) piercing damage plus 24 (7d6) radiant damage.

action.name: Summon Faeries (1/day)
action.text: Titania can use an action to summon 1d12 spring or summer faeries. They appear in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of her.

monster.spells: dancing lights, druidcraft, faerie fire, light, message, animate objects, banishment, charm person, counterspell, confusion, detect magic, detect thoughts, dimension door, dispel magic, fog cloud, hypnotic pattern, invisibility, mirror image, modify memory, control weather, heal, mass suggestion, mirage arcane, wish

monster.name: Toadman

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The toadman can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The toadman’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 15, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The toadman can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
At will: druidcraft, thorn whip
2/day: entangle, fog cloud, poison spray, speak with animals
1/day: animal messenger, feign death, pass without trace, plant growth, speak with plants, spike growth

trait.name: Leap
trait.text: The toadman can make a 10 ft. horizontal jump.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The toadman has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
trait.text: The toadman can speak with frogs and toads.

trait.name: Swamp Camouflage
trait.text: The toadman has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The toadman makes two attacks, one with his sword and one with his tongue.

action.name: Swamp Sword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage plus 24 (7d6) poison damage, DC 15 Constitution saving throw.

action.name: Twisted Tongue
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

monster.name: Tree of Dread

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the tree of dread remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal tree.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The tree of dread deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The tree of dread makes three slam attacks with its branches.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (3d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Animate Trees (1/day)
action.text: The tree of dread magically animates 1d4 trees it can see within 60 feet of it. These trees have the same statistics as the tree of dread, except they have Intelligence and Charisma scores of 1, they can’t speak, and they have only the Slam action option. An animated tree acts as an ally of the tree of dread. The tree remains animated for 1 day or until it dies; until the tree of dread dies or is more than 120 feet from the tree of dread; or until the tree of dread takes a bonus action to turn it back into an inanimate tree. The tree then takes root if possible.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 90 (Third Party)

monster.name: Troll, River

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The river troll can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The river troll has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Regenerate
trait.text: The river troll regains 12 hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes fire damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of the river troll’s next turn. The river troll only dies if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn’t regenerate.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The river troll deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The river troll makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) slashing damage.

action.name: Drown
action.text: When a river troll hits with a claw attack it can attempt to grapple the target and drown it (DC 16 Strength saving throw). Because of its size, the river troll can attempt to drown two Large or smaller targets at the same time.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 91 (Third Party)

monster.name: Unicorn, Black

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the black unicorn moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a horn attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The black unicorn’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The black unicorn can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
At will: detect evil and good, pass without trace, poison spray
1/day: dispel evil and good, entangle, silence

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The black unicorn has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: The black unicorn’s attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The black unicorn makes two attacks: one with its hooves and one with its horn.

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Horn
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Dark Touch (3/Day)
action.text: The black unicorn touches another creature with its horn. The target takes 11 (2d8 + 2) necrotic damage.

action.name: Teleport (1/Day)
action.text: The black unicorn magically teleports itself and up to three willing creatures it can see within 5 feet of it, along with any equipment they are wearing or carrying, to a location the unicorn is familiar with, up to 1 mile away.

legendary.name: Hooves attack
legendary.text: Makes one attack with its hooves.

legendary.name: Dark Shroud (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The black unicorn creates a shimmering, dark shroud around itself or another creature it can see within 60 ft. of it. The target gains a +2 bonus to AC until the end of the black unicorn’s next turn.

legendary.name: Heal Self (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: Magically regains 11 (2d8 + 2) hit points.

monster.spells: detect evil and good, pass without trace, poison spray, dispel evil and good, entangle, silence
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 92 (Third Party)

monster.name: Unicorn, Green

trait.name: Forest Camouflage
trait.text: The green unicorn has advantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks in the forest environment.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The green unicorn’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 14). The green unicorn can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
At will: druidcraft, resistance
1/day: cure wounds, entangle, moonbeam, purify food and drink, speak with animals, speak with plants, spike growth

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The green unicorn has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The green unicorn makes two attacks: one with its hooves and one with its horn.

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Horn
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

monster.spells: druidcraft, resistance, cure wounds, entangle, moonbeam, purify food and drink, speak with animals, speak with plants, spike growth
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 93 (Third Party)

monster.name: Unicorn, Red

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the red unicorn moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a horn attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

trait.name: Heated Body
trait.text: A creature that touches the red unicorn or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 (1d10) fire damage.

trait.name: Illumination
trait.text: The red unicorn sheds bright light in a 10- foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The red unicorn’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The red unicorn can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
At will: fire bolt (from its horn)
1/day: blink, darkness, flaming sphere

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The red unicorn has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The black unicorn makes two attacks: one with its hooves and one with its horn.

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 2 (1d4) fire damage.

action.name: Horn
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) fire damage.

monster.spells: firebolt, blink, darkness, flaming sphere
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 94 (Third Party)

monster.name: Wild Horse
monster.languages: Understands Sylvan but can’t speak it

trait.name: Agile Equine
trait.text: The wild horse can use a bonus action to Disengage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The wild horse has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The wild horse makes two attacks with its hooves.

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Ethereal Stride (2/day)
action.text: The wild horse and its rider magically enter the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 95 (Third Party)

monster.name: Wild Hound
monster.languages: Understands Sylvan but can’t speak it

trait.name: Hasty Hound
trait.text: The wild hound can use a bonus action to Disengage or Hide.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
trait.text: The wild hound has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The wild hound has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the wild hound’s allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

action.name: Ethereal Stride (2/day)
action.text: The wild hound magically enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 96 (Third Party)

monster.name: Wild Rider

trait.name: Shapechanger
trait.text: The wild rider can use an action to shapechange into a wild horse or a wild hound. Once transformed they have the stats of that creature. All their weapons and equipment change with them. They must use an action to change back into their true form. If they are killed, they revert back to their true form with all their original hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The wild rider makes three attacks.

action.name: Spear of the Hunt
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. If the saving throw result is 7 or lower, the poisoned target falls unconscious for the same duration, or until it takes damage or another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 97 (Third Party)

monster.name: Witch
monster.speed: 40 ft., fly 80 ft. (with broom of flying)
monster.skill: Arcana +9, Deception +8, Insight +9, Perception +9, Persuasion +8, Stealth +8

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The witch has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: The witch is an 18th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). The witch can cast the following wizard spells.
Cantrips: acid splash, light, poison spray, prestidigitation
1st level (4 slots): charm person, disguise self, hex, mage armor, witch bolt
2nd level (4 slots): darkness, detect thoughts, misty step, suggestion
3rd level (3 slots): bestow curse, counterspell, fear, haste, lightning bolt
4th level (3 slots): blight, greater invisibility, polymorph
5th level (3 slots): conjure elemental, dominate person, scrying
6th level (2 slots): disintegrate
7th level (1 slot): forcecage
8th level (1 slot): control weather
9th level (1 slot): power word kill

trait.name: Water Susceptibility
trait.text: For every 5 ft. the witch moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 10 cold damage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The witch makes two attacks.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage. Evil witches have poisoned daggers, targets must make a successful DC 19 Constitution saving throw or take 24 (7d6) poison damage, half damage on a save.

action.name: Broom of Flying
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
reaction.text: When an attacker that the witch can see hits it with an attack, the witch can use its reaction to halve the attack’s damage against it.

monster.spells: acid splash, light, poison spray, prestidigitation, charm person, disguise self, hex, mage armor, witch bolt, darkness, detect thoughts, misty step, suggestion, bestow curse, counterspell, fear, haste, lightning bolt, blight, greater invisibility, polymorph, conjure elemental, dominate person, scrying, disintegrate, forcecage, control weather, power word kill
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 98 (Third Party)

monster.name: Witch King

trait.name: Aura of Fear
trait.text: Any creatures within 60 ft. of the witch king must make a successful DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The witch king’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 20). The witch king can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.
At will: detect magic, minor illusion, prestidigitation
3/day: darkness, detect thoughts, dimension door, dispel magic, dominate person, fog cloud, water walk

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The witch king has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The witch king makes three attacks with his greatsword.

action.name: +3 Greatsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d6 + 9) slashing damage plus 24 (7d6) necrotic damage.

reaction.name: Parry
reaction.text: The witch king adds 2 to his AC against one melee attack that would hit him. To do so, the witch king must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monster.spells: detect magic, minor illusion, prestidigitation, darkness, detect thoughts, dimension door, dispel magic, dominate person, fog cloud, water walk
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 99 (Third Party)

monster.name: Forget Frog

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The forget frog can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Standing Leap
trait.text: The forget frog’s long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The forget frog can make two spit attacks.

action.name: Spit Poison
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) acid damage.

action.name: Steal Memory (1/day)
action.text: The forget frog targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it with its gaze. The target takes 14 (4d6) psychic damage, and it must make a DC 14 Intelligence saving throw. On a successful save, the target becomes immune to this forget frog’s Steal Memory for 24 hours. On a failed save, the target loses all proficiencies, it can’t cast spells, it can’t understand language, and if its Intelligence and Charisma scores are higher than 7, they become 7. Each time the target finishes a long rest, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. A greater restoration or remove curse spell cast on the target ends this effect early.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 100 (Third Party)

monster.name: Giant Butterfly

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The giant butterfly has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Beat Wings
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) force damage and the target must make a successful DC 11 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland p. 101 (Third Party)

monster.name: Giant Dragonfly

action.name: Bite

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The giant fox has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the giant fox’s allies is within 5 feet. of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

action.name: Bite

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
trait.text: The giant rabbit has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

action.name: Bite

monster.name: Giant Swan

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the giant swan moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a bite attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 1 piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 11 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
trait.text: The giant swan has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Bite. Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.
