monster.name: Victoria Van Vamp

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: Victoria has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t put her to sleep.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Victoria is a 12th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks). She has the following wizard spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): chill touch, dancing lights, fire bolt, message
1st level (4 slots): charm person, mage armor, magic missile, sleep
2nd level (3 slots): hold person, invisibility, misty step, suggestion
3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, fireball, lightning bolt
4th level (3 slots): banishment, blight, dimension door
5th level (2 slots): dominate person, modify memory

action.name: Intoxicating Touch
action.text: Victoria touches a willing creature or a creature charmed by her. The creature must make a successful DC 22 Wisdom saving throw or follow Victoria’s orders. Each time Victoria or her companions do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts for 24 hours or until Victoria dies, is on a different plane of existence than the target, or takes a bonus action to end the effect.

action.name: Hypnotic Gaze
action.text: As an action, she can choose one creature that she can see within 30 feet of her. If the target can see or hear her, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against DC 22 or be charmed by her until the end of her next turn. The charmed creature’s speed drops to 0, and the creature is incapacitated and visibly dazed.

monster.spells: chill touch, dancing lights, fire bolt, message, charm person, mage armor, magic missile, sleep, hold person, invisibility, misty step, suggestion, counterspell, fireball, lightning bolt, banishment, blight, dimension door, dominate person, modify memory

trait.name: Aura of Beauty
trait.text: Bella Rose has advantage on Charisma checks and saving throws against any humanoid within 30 ft.

trait.text: On each of her turns, Bella Rose can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

If a target succeeds on their saving throw, they are immune to the effect for the next hour.

monster.name: Cobweb Kelly

trait.name: Cunning Action
trait.text: On each of her turns, Cobweb Kelly can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Shapechange
trait.text: Cobweb Kelly can use a bonus action to turn into a giant spider. While in that form she has the statistics of the spider. If she is killed, she reverts back to her fey form with her full hit points. Any equipment she is wearing or carrying is transformed with her.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: Cobweb Kelly can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Cobweb Kelly makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Rapier
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Web
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. Hit: The target is restrained by webbing. As an action, the restrained target can make a DC 15 Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10, hp 5; vulnerability to fire damage, immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

reaction.name: Parry
reaction.text: Cobweb Kelly spins a web and adds 2 to her AC against one melee attack that would hit her.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 75 (Third Party)

monster.name: Corrupted Hatter

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: The Hatter has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t put him to sleep.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The Hatter’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 19, +11 to hit with spell attacks). The Hatter can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:
At will: detect thoughts, mage hand, prestidigitation
3/day each: charm person, counterspell, dispel magic, invisibility, misty step, suggestion, wall of thorns
1/day each: dimension door, dominate person, eyebite, modify memory, seeming, suggestion

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The Hatter has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The Hatter makes two attacks with his hats.

action.name: Throw Hat
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. On a hit the hat lands on the target’s head. Each type of hat has different effects. The hatter has two of each hat in his bag.
Hat of Anxiety. The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns.
Hat of Depression. The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or become incapacitated for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns.

Hat of Outrage. The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or spend their turn being paralyzed and screaming out nonsense words at everyone. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns.

Hat of Confusion. The targeted creature must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or use all of its movement to move in a random direction. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns.

action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Drone (3/Day)
action.text: Jim Jam can use an action to begin to drone on and on about a specific topic. All creatures within 30 ft. must make a successful DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or fall asleep for 1d4 minutes. If the target takes any damage, the effect ends. Another creature can use an action to wake the sleeping target.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 81 (Third Party)

monster.name: Orion

trait.name: Brave
trait.text: Orion has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

trait.name: Cunning Action
trait.text: On each of his turns, Orion can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Land’s Stride
trait.text: Moving through nonmagical difficult terrain costs him no extra movement. He can also pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed down by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or a similar hazard. In addition, he has advantage on saving throws against plants that are magically created or manipulated to impede movement, such as those created by the entangle spell.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Orion has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Orion makes two melee attacks.

action.name: +2 Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d10 + 6) slashing damage.

action.name: +2 Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
reaction.text: Orion adds 2 to his AC against one melee attack that would hit him. He must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 82 (Third Party)

monster.name: The Puzzleman

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The Puzzleman has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Shapechange
trait.text: The Puzzleman can use a bonus action to polymorph into a Large or smaller object, or return to his true fey form. His statistics are the same in any form and anything he is wearing or carrying is transformed. If he dies, he reverts to his true fey form.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The Puzzleman makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Puzzle Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Fall to Pieces
reaction.text: The Puzzleman can fall to pieces momentarily and add 4 to his AC. Then he reforms back into himself.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 83 (Third Party)

monster.name: Self-Doubt Trout
monster.resist: acid, fire, lightning, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing not made with silvered weapons
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
trait.text: The self-doubt trout can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is in Feyland, and vice versa.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
trait.text: The self-doubt trout can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 2 (1d4) damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the self-doubt trout has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Withering Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Etherealness
action.text: The self-doubt trout enters the Ethereal Plane from Feyland, or vice versa. It is visible in Feyland while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can’t affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

action.name: Self-Doubt Possession (Recharge 2–3)
action.text: One humanoid that the self-doubt trout can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 13 Charisma saving throw or be possessed by the trout; the trout then disappears, and the target is wracked by doubt for 1d4 minutes. The target makes all attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks at disadvantage. The self-doubt trout can’t be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that turn undead. The possession ends after that period of doubt or the trout is turned or forced out by an effect like the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the self-doubt trout reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to the trout’s Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 84 (Third Party)

monster.name: Shadow Man
monster.resist: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, restrained, unconscious

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
trait.text: The shadow man can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends it turn inside an object.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
trait.text: While in dim light or darkness, the shadow man can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the shadow man has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Drain Abilities
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (4d6 + 3) necrotic damage and one of the target’s ability scores is reduced by 1d4. The target dies if this reduces any ability score to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest. If a non-evil humanoid dies from this attack, a new shadow man rises from the corpse one hour later.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 85 (Third Party)

monster.name: Shady Slim

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: Shady Slim’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:
At will: locate object, detect thoughts, tongues
3/day each: counterspell, darkness, dispel magic, faerie fire, fear, mage armor, misty step, shield
1/day each: dominate person, legend lore, locate creature, modify memory, suggestion, wall of force

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Shady Slim has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
trait.text: While in dim light or darkness, Shady Slim can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Shady Slim makes three melee attacks.

action.name: +3 Whims Whip
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) slashing damage.

action.name: Force Gaze (Recharge 6)
action.text: Shady Slim can use an action on his turn to target one creature within 90 feet of him. If the target can see Shady Slim, the target must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or take 17 (5d6) force damage. If the target makes a successful saving throw, they are immune to Slim’s gaze for 24 hours.

monster.spells: locate object, detect thoughts, tongues, counterspell, darkness, dispel magic, faerie fire, fear, mage armor, misty step, shield, dominate person, legend lore, locate creature, modify memory, suggestion, wall of force
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 86 (Third Party)

monster.name: Sylvan Spy
monster.skill: Deception +7, Perception +6, Persuasion +7, Sleight of Hand +8, Stealth +8

trait.name: Cunning Action
trait.text: On each of its turns, the sylvan spy can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The sylvan spy’s innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:
At will: dancing lights, message, minor illusion
3/day each: charm person, disguise self, knock, spider climb
1/day each: fog cloud, silence

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The sylvan spy has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
trait.text: Once per turn, the sylvan spy deals an extra 14 (4d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the sylvan spy that isn’t incapacitated and the sylvan spy doesn’t have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: +3 Dagger
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d4 + 8) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
reaction.text: The sylvan spy halves the damage that it takes from an attack that hits it. The spy must be able to see the attacker.

monster.spells: dancing lights, message, minor illusion, charm person, disguise self, knock, spider climb, fog cloud, silence
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 87 (Third Party)

monster.name: The Toymaker

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The Toymaker’s innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:
At will: locate object, mending
2/day each: enlarge/reduce, invisibility, mage armor, unseen servant
1/day each: animate objects, fabricate, polymorph

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The Toymaker has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The Toymaker makes two melee attacks.

action.name: +3 Light Hammer
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Explosive Doll
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (3d8 + 4) force damage.

monster.spells: locate object, mending, enlarge/reduce, invisibility, mage armor, unseen servant, animate objects, fabricate, polymorph
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 88 (Third Party)

monster.name: Zoomer

trait.name: Blurred Movement
trait.text: Attack rolls against the zoomer have disadvantage unless the zoomer is incapacitated or restrained.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The zoomer’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). It can cast the following spells, requiring no components:
At will: druidcraft, mending
1/day each: animal friendship, locate object

trait.name: Zoom
trait.text: The zoomer can’t provoke opportunity attacks as it moves too quickly.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The zoomer makes three attacks.

action.name: Sling
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d4 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

monster.spells: druidcraft, mending, animal friendship, locate object
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 89 (Third Party)

monster.name: Corrupted Frog Witch

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The Frog Witch can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Extraordinary Leap
trait.text: The distance of her long jump is tripled; every foot of her walking speed that she spends on the jump allows her to move 3 feet.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The Frog Witch’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 21, +13 to hit with spell attacks). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:
At will: druidcraft, faerie fire, thorn whip
3/day each: animal messenger, counterspell, dispel magic, entangle, fog cloud, pass without trace, speak with plants, spike growth
1/day each: blight, confusion, control water, control weather, dimension door, insect plague, tree stride

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The Frog Witch has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: The Frog Witch’s attacks are magical.

trait.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
trait.text: The Frog Witch can communicate with frogs and toads as if they shared a language.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The Frog Witch makes two attacks.

action.name: Grim Swamp Staff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage. It is also the equivalent of a broom of flying. If the staff is lost or destroyed, the Frog Witch must take 1d6 days to craft another.

action.name: Tongue of the Toad
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage and the target must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw and take 24 (7d6) poison damage on a failed save, half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Croak (Recharge 5–6)
action.text: The Frog Witch lets out a thunderous croak in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw or take 42 (12d6) thunder damage on a failed save, half as much damage on a successful one. Any creatures in this area must also make a successful DC 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

monster.spells: druidcraft, faerie fire, thorn whip, animal messenger, counterspell, dispel magic, entangle, fog cloud, pass without trace, speak with plants, spike growth, blight, confusion, control water, control weather, dimension door, insect plague, tree stride
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 92 (Third Party)

monster.name: Corrupted Swan Maiden

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The swan maiden can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The swan maiden has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Shapechange
trait.text: As an action, the swan maiden can shapechange into a giant swanMOF, or back into its true form. The statistics remain the same for the maiden in either form. Whatever it is wearing or carrying is transformed. If the swan maiden dies, it reverts to its true form.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The swan maiden makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Eye Rays (Recharge 2–3)
action.text: The swan maiden shoots fire out of their eyes in a 30-foot cone. Any creatures in that area must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw or take 13 (2d8 + 4) fire damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 94 (Third Party)

monster.name: Darkshroom
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, paralyzed, petrified, prone, stunned

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the darkshroom remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal giant mushroom.

trait.name: Swamp Camouflage
trait.text: The darkshroom has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The darkshroom makes three fist attacks.

action.name: Fist
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Acidic Spores (Recharge 2–3)
action.text: A 30-foot-radius cloud of toxic spores extends out from the darkshroom. The spores spread around corners. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or take 14 (4d6) acid damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 95 (Third Party)

monster.name: Frog Dragon

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The frog dragon can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The frog dragon makes two attacks; one with its jaws and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Breath Attack (Recharge 5–6)
action.text: The frog dragon breathes poisonous gas and croaks in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) force damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 96 (Third Party)

monster.name: Frog Knight

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The frog knight can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The frog knight has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the frog knight’s allies is within 5 feet of that creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

trait.name: Standing Leap
trait.text: The frog knight’s long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The frog knight makes two attacks.

action.name: Spear
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) or 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 97 (Third Party)

monster.name: Ginger Snap

trait.name: Brave
trait.text: Ginger Snap has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

trait.name: Land’s Stride
trait.text: Moving through nonmagical difficult terrain costs her no extra movement. She can also pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spikes, or a similar hazard. In addition, she has advantage on saving throws against plants that are magically created or manipulated to impede movement, such as those created by the entangle spell.

trait.name: Vanish
trait.text: Ginger Snap can use the Hide action as a bonus action on her turn. Also, she can’t be tracked by nonmagical means, unless she chooses to leave a trail.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Ginger Snap makes two attacks.

action.name: +2 Greatsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage.

action.name: +3 Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Giant Killer
reaction.text: When a Large or bigger creature within 5 feet of Ginger Snap hits or misses her with an attack, she can use her reaction to attack that creature immediately after its attack, provided that she can see the creature.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 98 (Third Party)

monster.name: Grootslang

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The Grootslang has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The Grootslang regains 10 hit points on each of its turns as long as it has 1 hit point.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The Grootslang deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The Grootslang makes three melee attacks, one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 29 (5d8 + 7) piercing damage.

action.name: Stomp
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (4d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Trumpet Blast (Recharge 4–6)
action.text: The Grootslang blasts a thunderous noise from its trunk in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or take 45 (10d8) thunder damage, half damage on a success.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 99 (Third Party)

monster.name: Luna Tick

trait.name: Illumination
trait.text: The luna tick sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

action.name: Blood Drain
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage and the luna tick attaches itself to the target. While attached, the luna tick doesn’t attack. Instead, at the start of each of the luna tick’s turns, the target loses 2 (1d4) hit points due to blood loss. The luna tick can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. It does so after it drains 12 hit points of blood from the target, or the target dies. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach the luna tick.

action.name: Moonshine
action.text: The luna tick can use an action to glow even brighter from its thorax while in darkness. The light is as bright as the moon and any creature within 20 feet must make a successful DC 11 Wisdom saving throw. If the save is successful, the creature is immune to the effect for 24 hours. If the save is unsuccessful, roll 1d8 and the following effect occurs for 1 turn:
d8 Effect
1 - The creature rants incoherently, incapable of normal speech or spellcasting
2 - The creature attacks the nearest target
3 - The creature is frightened
4 - The creature can’t stop crying and is incapacitated
5 - The creature begins to hallucinate and is incapacitated
6 - The creature stares into space and is incapacitated
7 - The creature can’t stop laughing and is incapacitated
8 - The creature is stunned

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 100 (Third Party)

monster.name: Mockodile

trait.name: Hold Breath
trait.text: The mockodile can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The mockodile has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Swamp Camouflage
trait.text: The mockodile has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The mockodile can make three attacks: one with its bite or tail and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Mock (Recharge 2–3)
action.text: The mockodile can use an action to cast vicious mockery (5th level, DC 14).

monster.spells: vicious mockery
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 101 (Third Party)

monster.name: Neverever Beast

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The Neverever Beast has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The Neverever Beast regains 10 hit points at the start of each turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The Neverever Beast deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The Neverever Beast makes three melee attacks, one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (4d8 + 7) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Great Growl (Recharge 5–6)
action.text: The Neverever Beast growls loudly in a 120-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 23 Constitution saving throw or take 45 (10d8) radiant damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 102 (Third Party)

monster.name: Pussywillow

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: Pussywillow’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:
At will: dancing lights, faerie fire, thorn whip
1/day each: fog cloud, insect plague, spike growth

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Pussywillow makes two attacks, one of which can be a crushing hug.

action.name: Unarmed Attack
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Crushing Hug
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 15) if it is a Medium or smaller creature. Until the grapple ends, the target takes 8 (1d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of Pussywillow’s turns. Pussywillow can’t make attacks while grappling a creature in this way.

monster.spells: dancing lights, faerie fire, thorn whip, fog cloud, insect plague, spike growth
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 103 (Third Party)

monster.name: Riverdancer

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The riverdancer has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the riverdancer’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

trait.name: Water Walk
trait.text: The riverdancer can walk on water.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The riverdancer makes two attacks.

action.name: Unarmed Attack
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus the target is grappled (escape DC 15) and will begin to drown.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 104 (Third Party)

monster.name: Scholar of Summer

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The scholar’s innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 19, +11 to hit with spell attacks). He can cast the following spells, requiring no components:
At will: locate object, mage armor, tongues
3/day each: burning hands, faerie fire, fireball, legend lore, scorching ray, silence, wall of fire, zone of truth
1/day each: enthrall, modify memory, suggestion, sunbeam

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The scholar has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The scholar regains 10 hit points at the start of each turn if she has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
trait.text: While in dim light or darkness, the scholar can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The scholar makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Sunflower Sword
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage and 3 (1d6) fire damage.

action.name: Fiery Gaze
action.text: The scholar can use an action to target one creature within 30 feet of him. If the target can see the scholar, the target must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or become paralyzed until the start of the scholar’s next turn. If the target makes a successful saving throw, they are immune to the scholar’s fiery gaze for 24 hours.

monster.spells: locate object, mage armor, tongues, burning hands, faerie fire, fireball, legend lore, scorching ray, silence, wall of fire, zone of truth, enthrall, modify memory, suggestion, sunbeam
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 105 (Third Party)

monster.name: Scout Faerie

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The scout faerie has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
trait.text: The scout faerie can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

trait.name: Tree Stride
trait.text: Once on its turn, the scout faerie can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically into one living tree within its reach and emerge from a second living tree within 60 feet of the tree, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second tree.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The scout faerie makes two attacks.

action.name: +1 Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d4 + 6) piercing damage.

action.name: +1 Shortbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d4 + 6) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 106 (Third Party)

monster.name: Swamp Person
monster.languages: the languages they knew in life

trait.name: Swamp Camouflage
trait.text: The swamp person has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Spit Mud
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 107 (Third Party)

monster.name: Terrible Toad

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The terrible toad can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The terrible toad makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Fist
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Croak (2/Day)
action.text: The terrible toad croaks loudly in a 30-foot cone. Any creature in that area must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw or take 9 (2d8) thunder damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 108 (Third Party)

monster.name: Whirlybird

trait.name: Flyby
trait.text: The whirlybird doesn’t provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

trait.name: Keen Sight
trait.text: The whirlybird has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Whirlwind (Recharge 2–3)
action.text: Each creature in the whirlybird’s space must make a DC 13 Strength saving throw. On a failure a target takes 16 (3d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage and is flung up to 20 feet away from the whirlybird in a random direction and knocked prone. If a thrown target strikes an object, such as a rock or a wall, the target takes 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked prone. If the saving throw is successful, the target takes half the bludgeoning damage and isn’t flung away or knocked prone.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 109 (Third Party)

monster.name: Bounder

trait.name: Brave
trait.text: The bounder has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The bounder has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pounce
trait.text: If the bounder moves at least 20 feet straight towards a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the bounder can make one attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The bounder makes three attacks, one of which can be a bite or ram attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Ram
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 112 (Third Party)

monster.name: Canyon Crawler

trait.name: Tunneler
trait.text: The canyon crawler can burrow through solid rock at half its burrow speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The canyon crawler makes two attacks, one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) piercing damage.

action.name: Constrict
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 18). Until this grapple ends, the creature is restrained, and the canyon crawler can’t constrict another target.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 113 (Third Party)

monster.name: Corrupted Centaur Mage

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The centaur mage’s spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:
At will: blade ward, fire bolt, shocking grasp
3/day each: blur, charm person, hold person, scorching ray, sleep, thunderwave
1/day each: blink, counterspell, fear, mage armor

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The centaur mage has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Staff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) necrotic damage.

monster.spells: blade ward, fire bolt, shocking grasp, blur, charm person, hold person, scorching ray, sleep, thunderwave, blink, counterspell, fear, mage armor

monster.name: Corrupted Orchid

trait.name: Fey Step (Recharge 4–6)
trait.text: As a bonus action, Orchid can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space she can see.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: Orchid’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:
At will: dancing lights, detect magic, faerie fire
3/day each: banishment, blur, charm person, counterspell, darkness, dispel magic, fear
1/day each: dimension door, dominate person, fireball

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The Orchid has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: Orchid’s weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
trait.text: While in dim light or darkness, Orchid can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Orchid makes three attacks with her sword.

action.name: Honey Sword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage. Her sword drips with honey and some of it sticks to a creature she hits. If she is successful with a hit, she has advantage on all further sword attacks against that target.

monster.spells: dancing lights, detect magic, faerie fire, banishment, blur, charm person, counterspell, darkness, dispel magic, fear, dimension door, dominate person, fireball
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 115 (Third Party)

monster.name: Count Batty

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: Count Batty regains 10 hit points at the start of his turn if he has at least 1 hit point and isn’t in sunlight or running water. If he takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn’t function at the start of his next turn.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Count Batty is a 12th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks). He can cast the following spells:
Cantrips (at will): chill touch, mage hand, poison spray, prestidigitation
1st level (4 slots): comprehend languages, fog cloud, ray of sickness, sleep
2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts, gust of wind, mirror image
3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, bestow curse, nondetection
4th level (1 slot): blight, confusion, greater invisibility
5th level (1 slot): animate objects, dominate person

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: Count Batty can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
trait.text: Count Batty takes 20 radiant damage when he starts his turn in sunlight. While in the sunlight, he has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is incapacitated or restrained. Hit: 9 (1d6 + 6) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. The target’s hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the count regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. A humanoid slain in this way and then buried in the ground rises the following night as a vampire spawn under the count’s control.

action.name: Charm
action.text: Count Batty targets one humanoid he can see within 30 feet. If the target can hear him, the target must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or be charmed. The charmed target regards the count as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Each time the count or his companions do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 12 hours or until the count is destroyed, is on a different plane of existence than the target, or takes a bonus action to end the effect.

monster.spells: chill touch, mage hand, poison spray, prestidigitation, comprehend languages, fog cloud, ray of sickness, sleep, detect thoughts, gust of wind, mirror image, animate dead, bestow curse, nondetection, blight, confusion, greater invisibility, animate objects, dominate person
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 116 (Third Party)

monster.name: Dark Wyvern

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in direct sunlight, the dark wyvern has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Turn Defiance
trait.text: The dark wyvern has advantage on effects that turn undead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dark wyvern makes three melee attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 29 (4d10 + 7) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 19).

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) slashing damage.

action.name: Stinger
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d8 + 7) piercing damage plus 24 (7d6) necrotic damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 118 (Third Party)

monster.name: Giant Pumpkin

trait.name: Illumination
trait.text: The giant pumpkin sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The giant pumpkin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The giant pumpkin deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in direct sunlight, the giant pumpkin has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The giant pumpkin makes four attacks, one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 29 (5d8 + 7) piercing damage and the target is swallowed. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks from outside the giant pumpkin, and it takes 17 (5d6) acid damage at the start of each of the giant pumpkin’s turns. If the giant pumpkin dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.

action.name: Squash
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (4d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 119 (Third Party)

monster.name: Giant Scarecrow
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, unconscious

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The giant scarecrow has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The giant scarecrow deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in direct sunlight, the giant scarecrow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The giant scarecrow makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. The target’s hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.

action.name: Scream of the Queen (3/Day)
action.text: The giant scarecrow screams like the Queen of Darkness. This scream has no effect on constructs and undead. All other creatures within 90 ft. that hear it must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 120 (Third Party)

At will: dancing lights, fire bolt, message
3/day each: burning hands, fireball, hypnotic pattern, mage armor, scorching ray, wall of fire
1/day each: delayed blast fireball, dimension door, invisibility

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The Harvest Lord has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

monster.name: Huntaur Warlord

trait.name: Brave
trait.text: The huntaur warlord has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the huntaur warlord moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target then hits it with a longsword attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 5 (1d10) damage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The huntaur warlord makes three attacks; one with its hooves and two with its sword or bow.

action.name: Hooves

action.name: Longsword

reaction.name: Parry
reaction.text: The huntaur adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the huntaur must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

At will: minor illusion, vicious mockery
2/day each: crown of madness, dissonant whispers, fog cloud, silence, stinking cloud
1/day each: cloud of daggers, feign death

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Long Legs has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.text: Strangelove targets one creature within 60 ft. of him. If the target can see him, the target must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or be blinded until magic such as the lesser restoration spell removes the blindness.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Trick and Treat has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
trait.text: While in dim light or darkness, Trick and Treat can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in direct sunlight, Trick and Treat has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack

action.name: Candy Corn Axe
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) sugar damage.

action.name: Trick
action.text: Trick and Treat can use an action on its turn to target one creature within 30 feet of it. If the target can see Trick and Treat, the target must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or fall under the effects of the confusion spell.

action.name: Treat
action.text: Trick and Treat can use an action on its turn to target one creature within 30 feet of it. If the target can see Trick and Treat, the target must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or become overwhelmed with euphoria. The target is effectively stunned until the end of its next turn.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 127 (Third Party)

monster.name: Witch Queen

trait.name: Ambusher
trait.text: In the first round of combat, the Witch Queen has advantage on attack rolls against any creature she surprises.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the Witch Queen fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: The Witch Queen is a 20th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 21, +13 to hit with spell attacks). She can cast the following spells, requiring no components:
Cantrips (at will): acid splash, fire bolt, poison spray, prestidigitation, ray of frost
1st level (4 slots): charm person, disguise self, hex, witch bolt
2nd level (3 slots): darkness, detect thoughts, misty step, suggestion
3rd level (3 slots): bestow curse, counterspell, fear, haste, lightning bolt
4th level (3 slots): blight, greater invisibility, polymorph
5th level (3 slots): conjure elemental, dominate person, scrying
6th level (2 slots): circle of death, disintegrate
7th level (2 slots): finger of death, forcecage
8th level (1 slot): control weather
9th level (1 slot): power word kill

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The Witch Queen makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Grim Broomstick
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage. It also functions as a magical broomstick of flying.

legendary.name: Cantrip
legendary.text: The Witch Queen casts a cantrip.

legendary.name: Move
legendary.text: The Witch Queen moves without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The Witch Queen casts one spell from her Spellcasting trait.

3/day each: legend lore, lightning bolt, misty step, passwall, tongues, wall of force, wind walk
1/day each: counterspell, dispel magic, dream, feather fall, gaseous form, plane shift, mass suggestion, unseen servant

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
trait.text: While in dim light or darkness, the dust monster can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

action.name: Dust Tentril
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 135 (Third Party)

monster.name: Frost Minotaur

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the frost minotaur moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.

trait.name: Labyrinthine Recall
trait.text: The frost minotaur can perfectly recall any path it has traveled.

trait.name: Reckless
trait.text: At the start of its turn, the frost minotaur can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Wintery Movement
trait.text: The frost minotaur can travel through icy and snowy terrain with no penalty for difficult terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The frost minotaur makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Frozen Greataxe
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d12 + 5) slashing damage plus 4 (1d8) cold damage.

action.name: Gore
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage and 3 (1d6) cold damage.

action.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 2–3)
action.text: The frost minotaur exhales an icy breath in a 30-foot cone. Any creatures in that area must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 17 (5d6) cold damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 136 (Third Party)

monster.name: Giant Yeti

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The giant yeti has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Snow Camouflage
trait.text: The giant yeti has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

trait.name: Wintery Movement
trait.text: The giant yeti can travel through icy and snowy terrain with no penalty for difficult terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The giant yeti makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage.

action.name: Ice Club
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 26 (4d8 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) cold damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 137 (Third Party)

monster.name: Head Chancellor of the Academy

trait.name: Academic Aura
trait.text: Any creature within 40 ft. of the chancellor has their Intelligence raised by 2 points and their Wisdom lowered by 4 points.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The chancellor’s innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 20, +12 to hit with spell attacks). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:
At will: detect magic, detect thoughts, locate object, tongues
3/day each: banishment, dimension door, hypnotic pattern, legend lore, magic missile, silence, suggestion, zone of truth
2/day each: enthrall, mage armor, mass suggestion, modify memory

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The chancellor has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The chancellor regains 10 hit points at the start of his turn if he has at least 1 hit point.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The chancellor makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Rod of Righteousness
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 27 (6d8) force damage.

monster.spells: detect magic, detect thoughts, locate object, tongues, banishment, dimension door, hypnotic pattern, legend lore, magic missile, silence, suggestion, zone of truth, enthrall, mage armor, mass suggestion, modify memory
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 138 (Third Party)

monster.name: Ice Prince

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The Ice Prince’s innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:
At will: chill touch (5th level), ray of frost (5th level)
3/day each: bestow curse, dispel magic, magic missile, misty step
1/day each: cone of cold, gust of wind, ice storm, invisibility

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The prince has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Wintery Movement
trait.text: The Ice Prince can travel through icy and snowy terrain with no penalty for difficult terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The Ice Prince makes two attacks.

action.name: Ice Mace
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) cold damage.

monster.spells: chill touch, ray of frost, bestow curse, dispel magic, magic missile, misty step, cone of cold, gust of wind, ice storm, invisibility
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 139 (Third Party)

monster.name: Ice Wing

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The ice wing has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The ice wing regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Snow Camouflage
trait.text: The ice wing has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The ice wing makes three melee attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 16) if it is a Medium or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the ice wing can only grapple one target at a time.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) slashing damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 140 (Third Party)

monster.name: Keeper of the Tomes
monster.languages: Common, Sylvan, Elvish, Abyssal, Draconic, Giant, Infernal

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The Keeper of the Tomes has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: The Keeper of the Tomes is a 7th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 19, +11 to hit with spell attacks). She has the following wizard spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation, vicious mockery
1st level (4 slots): comprehend languages, detect magic, illusory script, unseen servant
2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts, locate object, silence
3rd level (2 slots): counterspell, dispel magic, hypnotic pattern

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The Keeper of the Tomes makes eight attacks with her tentacles.

action.name: Tentacles
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

monster.spells: mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation, vicious mockery, comprehend languages, detect magic, illusory script, unseen servant, detect thoughts, locate object, silence, counterspell, dispel magic, hypnotic pattern
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 141 (Third Party)

monster.name: Library Golem
monster.immune: poison, psychic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks not made with adamantine weapons
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone
monster.languages: understands Common and Sylvan but can’t speak

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the golem remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a large bookcase.

trait.name: Immutable Form
trait.text: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: The golem’s weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The golem makes two attacks.

action.name: Metal Quill
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) piercing damage.

action.name: Shoot Book
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range 30/80 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 142 (Third Party)

monster.name: Modo Dodo

trait.name: Dumb Luck (3/Day)
trait.text: Modo Dodo can reroll an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Modo Dodo has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Modo Dodo makes two attacks, one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Kick
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 143 (Third Party)

monster.name: Punk Scholar

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: The punk scholar is a 7th-level bard. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following bard spells:
Cantrips (at will): dancing lights, minor illusion, vicious mockery
1st level (4 slots): charm person, dissonant whispers, sleep, thunderwave
2nd level (3 slots): calm emotions, detect thoughts, suggestion
3rd level (3 slots): dispel magic, hypnotic pattern, stinking cloud
4th level (1 slot): compulsion

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The punk scholar has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The punk scholar makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Scepter of Insanity
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 4 (1d8) necrotic damage.

action.name: Taunt (3/Day)
action.text: The punk scholar can use a bonus action on its turn to target one creature within 30 feet of it. If the target can hear the punk scholar, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or have disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the start of the punk scholar’s next turn.

monster.spells: dancing lights, minor illusion, vicious mockery, charm person, dissonant whispers, sleep, thunderwave, calm emotions, detect thoughts, suggestion, dispel magic, hypnotic pattern, stinking cloud, compulsion
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 144 (Third Party)

monster.name: Rogue Scholar

trait.name: Aura of Protection
trait.text: Any allies within 30 ft. of the scholar adds +2 to their saving throws.

trait.name: Brave
trait.text: The rogue scholar has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The rogue scholar’s innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). It can cast the following spells, requiring no components:
At will: detect magic, locate object, tongues
3/day each: faerie fire, legend lore, mage armor, magic missile, misty step, shield, silence, zone of truth
1/day each: fly, lightning bolt

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The rogue scholar makes two attacks.

action.name: +2 Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) slashing damage.

monster.spells: detect magic, locate object, tongues, faerie fire, legend lore, mage armor, magic missile, misty step, shield, silence, zone of truth, fly, lightning bolt
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 145 (Third Party)

monster.name: Scholar of Winter

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The scholar’s innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 20, +12 to hit with spell attacks). He can cast the following spells, requiring no components:
At will: chill touch, locate object, ray of frost, tongues
3/day each: banishment, cone of cold, hypnotic pattern, legend lore, mage armor, silence, zone of truth
1/day each: enthrall, modify memory, sleet storm, suggestion

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The scholar has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The scholar regains 10 hit points at the start of each of his turns if he has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
trait.text: While in dim light or darkness, the scholar can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The Scholar of Winter makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Ice Staff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d8) bludgeoning damage plus 17 (5d6) cold damage.

action.name: Frigid Stare (Recharge 4–6)
action.text: The scholar can use an action to target one creature within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the scholar, the target must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or take 31 (9d6) cold damage.

monster.spells: chill touch, locate object, ray of frost, tongues, banishment, cone of cold, hypnotic pattern, legend lore, mage armor, silence, zone of truth, enthrall, modify memory, sleet storm, suggestion
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 146 (Third Party)

monster.name: Skyballer

trait.name: Brave
trait.text: The skyballer has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

trait.name: Flyby
trait.text: The skyballer doesn’t provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The skyballer makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Skyball Scoop
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Throw Skyball
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (3d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 147 (Third Party)

monster.name: Thelonius Punk

trait.name: Cunning Action
trait.text: On each of his turns, Thelonius can use a bonus action take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Thelonius has advantage against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Thelonius is a 15th-level bard. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 20, +12 to hit with spell attacks). He has the following spells:
Cantrips (at will): dancing lights, mage hand, minor illusion, vicious mockery
1st level (4 slots): charm person, dissonant whispers, sleep, thunderwave
2nd level (3 slots): calm emotions, detect thoughts, suggestion
3rd level (3 slots): dispel magic, hypnotic pattern, stinking cloud
4th level (3 slots): compulsion, dimension door, greater invisibility
5th level (2 slots): dominate person, scrying
6th level (1 slot): mass suggestion
7th level (1 slot): forcecage
8th level (1 slot): glibness

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Thelonius makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Paintbrush of the Punks
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (3d8) poison damage plus the target must make a successful DC 19 Constitution saving throw or become paralyzed until the end of their next turn.

action.name: Lute of Distortion (Recharge 5–6)
action.text: Thelonius plays his magical lute, and it sends out a sonic blast in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw or take 54 (12d8) force damage, half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Cantrip
legendary.text: He casts a cantrip.

legendary.name: Paintbrush (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: He makes a Paintbrush of the Punks attack.

legendary.name: Exert Will (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: One creature charmed by Thelonius that he can see must use its reaction to move up to its speed as he directs or to make a weapon attack against a target that he designates.

monster.spells: dancing lights, mage hand, minor illusion, vicious mockery, charm person, dissonant whispers, sleep, thunderwave, calm emotions, detect thoughts, suggestion, dispel magic, hypnotic pattern, stinking cloud, compulsion, dimension door, greater invisibility, dominate person, scrying, mass suggestion, forcecage, glibness
monster.description: Source: Monsters of Feyland 2 p. 148 (Third Party)
